TRLs.name: Basic Principles Observed and Reported
TRLs.description: Foundational scientific research; basic scientific principles are observed and reported.
TRLs.environment: Controlled lab/office theoretical or experimental setting

TRLs.name: Technology Concept and/or Application Formulated
TRLs.description: Conceptual application formulated based on observed principles.
deliverables: Conceptual design documents or analytical models
Process flow diagrams or design sketches
TRLs.scale: Paper → Pieces (analytical models or desk simulations)

TRLs.name: Analytical and Experimental Proof‑of‑Concept
TRLs.description: Laboratory proof‑of‑concept via analyses and early prototypes.
deliverables: Performance reports comparing measured vs. predicted metrics

TRLs.name: Component and/or Breadboard Validation in Laboratory Environment
TRLs.description: Integration of components into a lab‑based breadboard setup.

TRLs.name: Component and/or Breadboard Validation in Relevant Environment
TRLs.description: Testing in environments representative of intended conditions.
deliverables: Prototype test data under simulated conditions
Mapping of prototype behavior to application requirements
TRLs.environment: Simulated field environments or environmental chambers
TRLs.scale: Engineering scale (bench → engineering plant level testing)

TRLs.name: System/Subsystem Model or Prototype Demonstration in Relevant Environment
deliverables: Working prototype with BOM and interface docs
Preliminary cost, schedule, and requirements traceability

TRLs.name: System Prototype Demonstration in Operational Environment
TRLs.description: Prototype tested in actual operational site's environment.
deliverables: Field test reports, QA logs, issue tracking

TRLs.name: Actual System Completed and Qualified Through Test & Demo
TRLs.description: Final system design proven under expected conditions.

TRLs.name: Actual System Proven Through Successful Mission Operations
TRLs.description: System successfully deployed, operating under real‑world conditions.
deliverables: Operational data demonstrating reliability and performance
Training materials and user support documentation
